column4: How do you get GPG keys if your company firewall/proxy blocks oort 11371?
vpn to another system and do it from there?
sounds good, whats the login to your vpn?
do you have a home computer that you can setup for vpn?
i do, but isn't setting up vpn quite involved? also does vpn use a non-standard port too that may be blocked?
you can setup vpn on any port you want
do you think I could make a lot of money if i hosted keys on port 80?
the GPG keys I'm trying to get
I don't know I never had a problem getting them but never been to a place like you with restrictions
seem the last one I got eather was mailed or used port 80
and I'm cheap so I got it free

I found that you can actually import GPG keys through "Accessories" -> "Passwords And Encryption Keys" or in terminal "gpg --import gpg-file" - all you need are the keys in text format - I think I will ssh into an outside box, get the text keys and import them...
you got me thinking, thanks for your input! And i may setup a vpn for that and other reasons too
ya then you can watch porn at work
